snippet: William C. Thompson Jr., a former city comptroller, easily topped the amounts that his likely rivals for the 2013 Democratic nomination collected during that period.
abstract: William C Thompson Jr, who lost the 2009 New York City mayor’s race to Michael R Bloomberg, announces that his current campaign collected more than $1 million in last six months, figure that easily tops funds collected by his likely rivals for the 2013 Democratic nomination for mayor.
lead_paragraph: William C. Thompson Jr., a former city comptroller, easily topped the amounts that his likely rivals for the 2013 Democratic nomination collected during that period.

headline.seo: Thompson’s Mayoral Campaign Raises $1 Million in 6 Months
headline.main: Thompson Raises $1 Million in 6 Months for Mayoral Bid
headline.print_headline: Thompson Raises $1 Million in 6 Months for Mayoral Bid
